intro: Stillingia nutans, commonly known as the nodding stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that droop downward. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a common feature in the Papaveraceae family. Stillingia nutans is often found in moist, wooded areas and is considered a rare and declining species.
